guide.title: Configuration Tools Requirements
guide.abstract: This document specifies the requirements for the config tools subproject.

body.p: This document specifies the requirements for the Configuration Tools subproject. Individual requirements are specified for every tool, describing the function of that specific tool. Some overall requirements are specified which are met by all tools.

ul.li: The tools can have more then one userinteface
The user can select a userinterface by specifing some commandline option (for example -g for a GUI)
If no commandline option is specified the GUI is tried
All tools can ask for the root password when necesary
The runlevel editor can start services
The runlevel editor can stop services
The runlevel editor can restart services
The runlevel editor can remove any service from any runlevel
The runlevel editor can display a description for every service in the list
The runlevel editor can display the status for any service in the list
The Network Configuration editor can display an overview of available ethernet interfaces

The Network Configuration editor can add ethernet interfaces
Add net.* links to /etc/init.d/
Edit /etc/conf.d/net
Autoload the appropriate module
The Network Configuration editor can remove ethernet interfaces (See the above)
The Network Configuration editor can configure a gateway
The Network Configuration editor can edit dns settings
